messages.content: Can we add a photo of a sad dog to the hero?

Added a sad dog image to the hero section of the page. The image is sourced from Unsplash and displays a dog with a concerned/sad expression, which fits perfectly with the emotional support theme. You may want to add CSS styling to the hero-image class in your styles.css file to control the image size and positioning.

changes.content:
üêï Woofington's Emotional Support Center

Where Dogs with Feelings Come to Feel Better About Their Feelings

Is Your Dog Having an Existential Crisis?

We specialize in dogs who are basically just furry humans with trust issues.

Our Services

üõãÔ∏è Emotional Cuddle Sessions

For dogs who need to be held and told "you're doing great, buddy" for 3 hours straight.

üì± Social Media Anxiety Management

Help your dog process why nobody liked their picture on Instagram.

üé™ Exposure Therapy for Leaf Sounds

Gently introduce your dog to the devastating realization that leaves make noise.

üíî Separation Anxiety Support Group

Circle time where dogs cry about that one time you left for 7 minutes.

üéÇ Existential Snack Breaks

Ponder life's big questions while eating artisanal dog treats.

üßò Mindful Napping Sessions

Professional sleep coaching because your dog's naps need structure.

Testimonials from Our Patients

"Before Woofington's, I couldn't even make eye contact with my owner. Now I can make eye contact for 0.5 seconds before the anxiety kicks back in. Progress!"

- Anxious Poodle, 4

"My goldfish left me emotionally devastated. The staff here understood my pain and didn't judge me for eating the remaining evidence."

- Traumatized Retriever, 7

"They taught me that the mailman isn't actually here to steal my entire existence. Life-changing."

- Previously Paranoid Chihuahua, 3

"I came in unable to handle the concept that my treat bowl was empty for more than 2 minutes. Now I can handle it for up to 3 minutes. 10/10."

- Formerly Dramatic Lab, 5

Is Your Dog Ready for Woofington's?

Check if your pup exhibits any of these signs:

  • ‚úì Dramatic sighs when you enter another room
  • ‚úì Stares out window for extended periods contemplating mortality
  • ‚úì Requires reassurance after their own sneezes
  • ‚úì Acts like they've never eaten before even though it's the 4th meal today
  • ‚úì Shivers uncontrollably when the weather changes 2 degrees
  • ‚úì Has 47 different anxiety-related barks
  • ‚úì Needs you to taste-test their water bowl first
  • ‚úì Acts personally victimized by their own shadow

If your dog checked off 3 or more, congratulations! They're emotionally needy enough to join our family.

Pricing Plans

The Gentle Soul

$45/day

  • 4 hours of emotional support
  • 1 cuddle session
  • Unlimited snack access

The Basket Case ‚≠ê POPULAR

$75/day

  • Full day care
  • 3 cuddle sessions
  • Group therapy circle
  • One-on-one anxiety counseling

The Hot Mess Express

$120/day

  • 24-hour monitoring
  • Unlimited cuddles
  • Premium therapy packages
  • Personal emotional support human

FAQ

Will my dog's feelings get hurt?

Possibly. But at least they'll be in a safe space where everyone understands that their feelings are valid and also slightly ridiculous.

What if my dog is TOO needy?

There's no such thing! That's like saying there's too much ice cream. We celebrate the chaos.

Do you offer virtual therapy?

We tried Zoom sessions, but dogs kept barking at themselves in the screen, which defeated the purpose. Now we're considering it for humans with anxiety about their dogs having Zoom anxiety.

What's included in a typical day?

Breakfast crisis management, morning feelings circle, philosophical walks, snack existentialism, afternoon cuddles, evening emotions debriefing, and the 6pm treat countdown anxiety we all share.

© 2024 Woofington's Emotional Support Center. All feelings welcome. Neuroses encouraged.

üìû 1-800-DOG-CRY | üìß help@woofingtons.com | üìç 123 Anxiety Lane, Nervous Hills, NJ
changes.explanation: Added an image of a sad dog to the hero section using an Unsplash URL. The image is placed between the description text and the CTA button, with a descriptive alt text and a new hero-image class for styling.
